summary: I am currently a Bioengineering PhD student working in Arjun Raj's lab at the University of Pennsylvania. My primary interests are genetics and immunology, but I'm excited about any field with intricate systems that can be explored in new, groundbreaking ways. I am also an active member of the Penn Science Policy and Diplomacy Group, where we design and host events to educate graduate students on the intersection of their work in STEM with government and how they can use their scientific background to influence policy.
headline: Bioengineering PhD Student at UPenn

courses.name: Principles of Controlled Release and Drug Formulation

certifications.name: Confronting Bias: Thriving Across Our Differences

organizations.name: Tau Beta Pi
organizations.description: Tau Beta Pi is the oldest national engineering honor's society. I was inducted into the Tufts chapter in my junior year.

organizations.name: Biomedical Engineering Society
organizations.description: I joined the Tufts chapter of the national Biomedical Engineering Society in my first year here, and became Career Development Chair at the start of my second. In that role, I worked to organize events with researchers and companies in the area, primarily technical lectures and industry tours. I set up a biweekly speaker series at the end of my sophomore year, which continued throughout my junior year despite the interference of COVID. Examples of speakers include researchers from the Broad Institute, Draper, and Pfizer. At the end of that year, I was elected co-president, and now I oversee all of the club's operations and lead meetings every week.

organizations.name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
organizations.description: I joined the Tufts chapter of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers in my first semester of college, and was soon elected Corporate Relations Chair. I have been in that role ever since, working to arrange industry speakers and tours so mechanical engineering students at Tufts can get better connections to job opportunities in the area. Examples of companies I have organized events with include Draper, iRobot, and Bose.

organizations.name: Tufts Robotics Club
organizations.description: I have been part of the Tufts Robotics Club since my first semester here, working on many small projects with other students here. Example projects include a path-following robot for a Halloween-themed robotics exhibition, a fighting robot for an in-school tournament, and a remote-controllable robot for a friend's birthday present.
